>

So, what *have* you heard about it??

Various modders have said things like it's unstable and clunky.

If I could remember specifics I'd tell you.

> 
> Considering that goes against everything I've heard about it in the past year, I'm still doubtful.

Kopernicus has come a long way during its development. Sure, it still has some issues to iron out such as those with the auto-complete contracts in career, but it's far from unstable. I've been using some sort of Kopernicus config in all of my playthroughs in 1.0.x KSP so far (OPM standalone, RSS, KScale2 + OPM + Trans-Keptunian) and have not had any issues in sandbox/science modes except one that was quickly fixed due to a small typo in the code.

As long as Kopernicus becomes more and more stable, I honestly do not really see a need for a new stock planet. True, it would be nice to have, but I am satisfied with using OPM for the foreseeable future.

Personally, while adding new planets is neat, I'd rather see more detail and content added to existing planets. Rather than just some generic biomes, I'd love to see some much more specific biome designations. For example, rather than just landing at "Kerbin's Mountains", I'd rather have "Kerbin Moutains - Western Range" or "Duna Mountains - Mt. Von Kermin", something like that; biomes that give me a sense of place beyond just being on the planet in question.

Basically, hitting a giant ball of rock in space is fun, but not particularly challenging. Hitting a specific and interesting part of said rock, and being able to get back afterwards, is a lot more compelling to me. That's just me though.

The poll is somewhat limited, I'd like to see more planets but it's a low priority, way below the priority of the unity 5 upgrade.

If a new planet was added, I'd hope that it had interesting features at both the orbital and surface level. For a couple of ideas at the orbital level:

Counter-Kerbin: a dwarf planet at Kerbol-Kerbin's L3 Lagrangian point. This would present an unusual challenge because there would be no transfer window to reach it directly.

A ringed planet: as well as looking pretty, it would serve as an interesting navigational hazard - as long as it had well-defined edges visible on the map view, you could choose either to avoid flying through the ring, or fly through the ring relying on some combination of matching orbital velocities and shielding sensitive components to avoid damage. Flying something through the ring and bringing it back for study would make a nice science contract too.

Ringed planet.

I want to fly though Cassini Division. (hint - book and movie)

I'm all for adding content to the game, but adding more planets will simply increase travel times to current planets w/o the game infrastructure to support them. I am in favor of doing other things to improve current game play, robotics such as Canada arm anyone (yes I know there are mods, but stock stuff usually turns out better)?

I would also love to see the inclusion of mini games for things such as science or maybe minor vessel repairs. KAS/KIS somewhat add this for orbital assembly of stations and ships. I enjoy being able to take useful science readings in game and transmit the findings back to Kerbin, but would like to see more than just "click, take a reading". 

 - Sample taking for example, you could have a contract to bring back a certain type of metalic sample, and to find it you need a metal detector which tells you if you're in the right location to obtain it (like the ISRU scanners do for resources).

 - A station based science mini game could involve blowing up things in a zero-G test chamber ("testing" materials).

 - Astronomy anyone? Aiming an orbital telescope at a specific target in the Kerbol sysytem and taking readings.

2 points come to mind from your post, the first is I agree that I`d rather have more to do on the planets we already have although once we get the ability for the game to be much less restricted memory wise with Unity 5 I`d like to see more textures, planets and other things that have had to be `rationalised` (read that as cut) due to the game running on a 32 bit environment.

The second is that Squad should be a little more informative and definitive when it comes to things like this. As you say, they have said nothing and we are supposed to take that as some form of information.

Really, sometimes I think we would get better info about the future of the game by throwing bones and examining chicken entrails. Maybe doing the I-Ching would help or possibly putting the game on one side of a large set of scales and a duck on the other side...
